bib_record.title: Cross section for 7Be production from 12C with protons of 3 - 12.5 GeV

free_txt: The Zero Gradient Synchrotron (ZGS) at
the Argonne National Laboratory.
The variation of counting efficiency over the face of
the NaI crystal was determined, and corrections of
about 2% were applied to the counting data after
taking into account the activity distribution in the
polyethylene after bombardment. An additional 0.5%
correction was applied to the gamma-ray counting
rates of the 1 cm and 2 cm thick targets for recoils
from the gold foil in contact with the upstream face.
This correction was determined from measurements on
aluminium foils which were downstream of a gold foil
during a bombardment.
The detector was a NaI crystal 7.6 cm in
diam. and 7.6 cm thick, and a single-channel analyzer
was set to accept counts in the photopeak region.
We estimate an overall error of 5% is
associated with the 7Be results, relative to the
published values for Sigma Al(24Na) and Sigma C(llC).
The absolute error is increased to 8% when the errors
in the reference cross sections are included.
The Zero Gradient Synchrotron (ZGS) at
the Argonne National Laboratory.
Internal bombardments were carried out
using polyethylene target foils of 600 microm or 127
microm thickness. The 0.478 MeV gamma ray from the
decay of 7Be was used to measure the number of 7Be
nuclei produced by direct counting of intact
polyethylene samples.
Cross section monitor.
Internal monitor for the
number of protons.
One was a disc 3.17 cm in diameter and 0.125 cm thick
which was cut from polyethylene of density 0.94
g/cm3. In order to monitor the proton intensity on
the target, an aluminum foil 50 micron thick
protected by 25 micron of aluminum on each side was
taped to the target. The other two sizes were
machined from polyethylene of 0.91 g/cm3 density to
thicknesses of 1.00 cm and 2.00 cm and square cross
section 2.54 cm on an edge. These targets had a stack
of three aluminum foils 25 micron thick and two gold
foils 12 micron thick attached to, and trimmed to fit,
the upstream and downstream faces of the polyethylene
for beam monitoring.
